issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Grace Hash Join loads the spilled partitions to complete the join in closeOp(). This should not happen when closeOp with abort is invoked. Instead it should clean up all the spilled data.
fields.summary: Grace Hash Join should not load spilled partitions on abort

comments.body: The code looks good to me. Thanks.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12727500 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

This doesn't seem right - the clear method you use leaves a broken partition behind right? You clean up some stuff but don't nuke the whole container. I think the logic should be: if it has any spilled partitions, throw away the whole container and make sure it's not in the cache (shouldn't be). If there are no partitions spilled leave alone for reuse.

Summary of offline discussion w/ [~prasanth_j]:

- Probably best to check if hash table is in registry (on abort). If it is: Ownership is shared, no need to clean up. If it isn't: MapJoinOp owns the table container and need to clean (+ free mem).

I had to restart Jenkins due to switch to GIT. 
Re-uploading patch.
[~hagleitn] Can you take a look again?
[~hagleitn] Addressed your review comments. Can you take another look? Hope it covers all cases now.
